Reviews.Title: “Great location, you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: utd7
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week stay in Berlin at this hotel & agree it is not high class but the rooms are clean, towels changed and maid calls each day. For the price could not really complain. Yes the passageways are tired looking, the entrance to the hotel is not impressive but this is not a 4 or 5 star hotel. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in the centre of Berlin, wants easy access to underground and has a limited budget. The one bedroom rooms are on the 5th floor and close to the restaurant where breakfast is served. We upgraded to the comfort rooms on the 2nd floor, as the first room we were given smelled of smoke. There are signs saying no smoking but obviously some choose to ignore them. The reception staff apologised and quickly found us another room. The beds are not very comfortable but standard basic hotel quality. From the airport take the airport express train to zoo gardens. Once you are outside the station look for the mercedes sign on the building roof & walk in that direction. The hotel is next door to the Saturn building. This is our 3rd trip to Berlin having stayed at Suite hotels before. We would return to Berliner Hof if we were to holiday there again, based on location and cost. The money we saved versus Suite hotels was our spending money for the week.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, vary basic hotel, poor beds and facilities”
Reviews.Author: dysonsphere
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is excellent for West Berlin. Transport links are good for the rail and underground links and the journey from Schonefeld by rail is around 1 hour with a few changes. The local area is excellent for shops, food and bars and the live music in the Irish Bar in the Europa Center is refreshingly close. The hotel is very basic. It has essentially had a lick of cheap paint in an attempt to make it less dull and dreary and this just left it looking somewhat pitiful. It is similar to sleeping in an old office building. The reception staff are efficient but nothing more. In no way is this a friendly place. The internet system is a ticket one where you purchase an hour or two and use that until it runs down after numerous uses. It is not cheap mind at 3 Euro for 2 hrs, 5 for 3 (makes no sense as that is actually more per hour) and 7.5 Euro for 5 hours. The connection is slow but stable. The rooms are tired and basic. They were though quiet although this may be because other people stayed somewhere better. No pictures on the walls just blank green/grey walls and a big uncomfortable bed which had two single mattresses which is terrible but made worse by the mattresses being evidently made of concrete. The duvets they provide are a joke as they simply provide two thin ones per bed; the cheapest that they could possibly have bought. The hallways of the place reminded me of a battleship in the uniform grey dullness. If I had been told i was staying in 1980's East Berlin I could have believed it. All in all a quite uncomfortable, cheap and tired experience which I would not repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Berliner Hof”
Reviews.Author: Hanne J
Reviews.Content: We were very dissapointed with this hotel. They made a huge argument with us leaving the hotel. We had to buy new make-up for our daughter, as the hotel staff accidently dropped the make-up bag into the toilet. No note! We found the bag soaked in water returning from our daytrip in Berlin. The hotel would not refund the make-up, but after a big diskussion the manager agreed to cover the loss. He sent us to KaDeWe to buy new maku up for her, but returning to the hotel after 2 hours looking for the things to be replayced, they would not pay the amount to us. We had a huge argument, and leaving the hotel the staff "forgot" to give us our passports!! We did not notice, as we were very upset and we were driving by car, not by plane - so the passports were fortunately not needed right away. 5 months later we needed the passports and they were not in our home. We were shocked to find out that the hotel had kept them for 5 months without any notice!! We wrote them by mail 3 times, but no response!! Finally I wrote them as if I wanted to book a room, and the responded within 2 minutes!!!! Having them in speach they wanted to know if we were the ones with the make-up bag!! Oh, yes they had right at this moment found our passports. I wrote the danish embassy in Berlin also, and they also contacted the hotel. We had to pay for the delivery + 10 Euros for the service!!!! WE WILL NEVER RETURN TO THIS HOTEL AGAIN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: soffis
Reviews.Content: After the initial chock of the poor quality of the room, I warmed up to the hotel. I had expected better quality but I guess in relation to the price it’s what you get. I had booked a single studio room, none smoking. The room was on the fifth floor and had a nice view. I'm pretty sure there had been smoking in the room before and as other hotels in Berlin, they try to hide it with some horrible sweet smelly spray. You can smell this throughout the hotel corridors and rooms. Part from the smell, the room was ok but don’t expect anything more than ok. It was clean except for the shower curtain which could use a wash. As reading other reviews about unfriendly staff I didn’t notice this but I didn’t have much interaction with them. I didn’t order the breakfast, I found the price too high and I had a quick look in the breakfast area and it didn’t look like it's worth it. I agree with previous reviews about a s a lovely bakery just down the street and you always have KadeWe which is good for food. The location of the hotel is great. You are close to u-bahn and s-bahn.

Reviews.Title: “berliner hof”
Reviews.Author: Pearl J
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel Nov 27th -02 Dec. My room was on 5th floor and I could not fault it. it was large clean and warm. the hotel staff were very helpful and friendley The hotel is in a great location and short walk from Zoo Garten train station. I would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “large clean rooms - affordable”
Reviews.Author: halsea
Reviews.Content: hotel was clean and very nice. terrific location. reasonable prices. front desk was pleasant and helpful, also spoke good english

Reviews.Title: “Horrific”
Reviews.Author: Clairege
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October for a work conference, and asides from a good location (main street near the subway), this ‘hotel’ can only be described as horrific. Entrance into the hotel is under a shop doorway and smells of urine, the rooms are unbelievably awful – I think I had blood stains on my carpet. The rooms are large, and the sheets seemed clean, however the room itself hasn’t be touched since the 80’s, and the carpets haven’t been cleaned. The walls were covered in suspect stains, the carpet – I’ve mentioned, and the bathroom – well, good luck. It reminded me of the room for Saw I. The reception staff are below standard too. Difficult, unqualified and unhelpful. For the price you pay - +100 euros – you’re better off staying at the Mark Apart apartments which are a 10 minute walk away. Avoid like the plague if you cannot handle to slum it.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable value for money”
Reviews.Author: AndrewJM70
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference in Berlin and managed to book this hotel for about half the price of the official conference hotels around the corner. Ok, if I was being ultra-critical, the room lacked some of the frills of the better hotels but for the price it was unbelievable value for money. The room was large, clean and comfortable and the service at the front desk was outstanding. For less than £60 per night I would have no hesitiation in recommending. Thanks to the staff for an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel, very reasonable prizes!”
Reviews.Author: vova4
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel, large rooms, very friendly, young stuff (English talking nice girls!) in the very centre of (West) Berlin with close connexion to 3 Metro Stations (including Berlin ZOO Station), busses! And the famous, giant store KADEWE... Right quiet! Very reasonable rates... (In London-Paris-Roma would it be probably 4-5 stars hotels, for much bigger rates). You can choose a big breakfast (not so cheap), or a "petite", two croissant and coffee (ok to start your day) for only 3 EURO... Berlin is bacaming more and more attractive, a culture metropolis, as ii was once... Beata and Wladimir, Copenhagen

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: CornishTraveller11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for us on a short city break. Our room was a mini suite, with lounge and kitchen area included, separate loo and bathroom. The hotel is situated on a busy shopping street with hop on hop off tour buses leaving from just across the road, and lots of opportunities nearby to buy local currywurst, kaffee und kuchen. KaDaWe the giant department store is just down the road and in the opposite direction Berlin Zoo and the interesting Story of Berlin attraction which was very informative.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel with good service at a good location”
Reviews.Author: Saralene
Reviews.Content: First of all I have to say that the service at the hotel was really good. The staff was really helpful, and every request by us was completed perfectly and quickly. The rooms were very large and clean. The room was divided into two rooms, one with the bed an closet, and one with a couch, table and tv. A big minus about our room was that it had a horrible smell, but after a few days you got used to it. First i thought it was a smoking room, but i later realized that it probably wasn't. I wouldn't like to know what the smoking rooms smell like! We were traveling with another couple and therefore saw two of the rooms. (The othe room didn't smell as bad!) Our room had a view to the street, but we weren't disturbed by any noise. The shower and toilet was separated, which came in handy in the mornings. Our room also had a little kitchenette (which we didn't use). I am not sure if the other couple had that, i think not The location of the hotel is very central. Just about 100 meters from KaDeWe. The hotel entrance is not on the street, but almost a bit hidden inside a little "passage". And you had to ring a doorbell and talk to the receptionist in order to get into the hotel the first time. Therefor the first impression of the hotel was not really that great. The breakfast was good, but the served exactly the same every morning. Overall the hotel was ok, it could have been better, but the service was really nice! Since we basically just were in the hotel to sleep, it was still OK for a sightseeing/shopping weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Nellikaramelli
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel; clean, tidy, friedly staff. Rooms are big. There are 3 beds and one sofa. Rooms are quiet and we did not hear the street noise. The location is very good if you travel with kids; nearby is the zoo, which is very nice. If you travel with teenagers there are several nice shops near. There are several nice cafes, restaurants and pubs in walkin distance. Metro is near and all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in prime location.”
Reviews.Author: Globe_Trotter1991
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Berliner Hof for four nights in April 2011. Got a great deal on the room, it was a comfort room with separate living and sleeping areas, 52 euros per night in central Berlin was a bargain. The hotel in a fantastic location right on Tauetzeinstrasse and steps away from the Ku'damm, the famous KaDeWe department store is just across the street which is a must see. The only negative is the fact that the hotel does not have a lobby or a place to meet people, you use your room key to enter and either walk up or get in the elevator to a small reception on the second floor. However for rooms of this quality at this price I strongly recommend the Hotel and will surely stay here next time i'm in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: charlie1977
Reviews.Content: Just back from a trip to Berlin and a stay at the Berliner Hof. I can't fault the hotel at all. The location is brilliant, right in the middle of it all on the K'Damn. We had a comfort room. It was large with a separate area that you could close off with a sliding door. Perfect for putting the kiddies to bed and having a few drinks while watching tv!! The room was also immaculate. The bathroom was separate to the toilet which was good. The shower was great!. Our room also had a small little kitchen with a fridge which comes in handy. Breakfast was lovely, the usual continental breakfast. Would definitely stay here if in Berlin again and I'll be recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rasmanrulz
Reviews.Content: It did exactly what we wanted. It was clean, accessible and the staff were friendly. The room was absolutely huge and very warm. The bed was reasonably comfy but the pillows a little odd. Overall it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Aijazz
Reviews.Content: really good location everything is near only 5min whit buss to brandenburg gate and zoo behind the hotel. i werent long way to other locations either,,,will take this hotel also on my next trip...hotel rooms are like a small apartment

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but not a traditional hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ianmac
Reviews.Content: The Berliner Hof is not like any hotel I have ever stayed in. But then, I have never stayed in a converted office block before - and I'm sure that is what the Berliner Hof is. Having said that, it is a perfectly good, clean budget hotel and the location is hard to beat. I walked to the hotel from Zoologischer Garten station in about ten minutes but walked past it a couple of times. That's because the entrance is located in a small shopping alleyway. The controlled entry is by way of a bell and reception is on the second floor. All the floors above that belong to the hotel and each room was, I am sure, an office unit in a previous life. That is no bad thing though, since it means the rooms are large and mine had a sitting area with a sofa and chairs. They serve breakfast (at extra cost) and it was adequate if unimaginative. You could stay at this hotel for weeks and never see anyone else, unless you met them on the lift. There are no public areas to speak of -- just a couple of chairs and tables at reception. But the staff were very pleasant indeed and helpful on the couple of occasions when wanted advice. The thing about this place is that it makes no pretence of being anything other than what it is, a value for money three star establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: DTnSF
Reviews.Content: Hotel Berliner Hof is a clean, modern, reasonably-priced hotel not far from the Zoological Gardens (and the Zoologischer Garten train station.) The nearest U-bahn station is Kurfürstendamm. The standard rooms are small but not ridiculously so, pretty much standard size for European rooms. Our room was immaculate and the bed was comfortable. The shower was very tiny - hard to turn around in - and my only real complaint was that the only soap provided was a liquid soap dispenser near the bathroom sink. So to get soap in the shower, you had to reach around the shower curtain, around a short wall and try to get soap out of the dispenser and back to the shower without getting water everywhere or slipping and falling. It was a bit ridiculous. The WiFi connection in the room was good (and there was also a wired (ethernet) internet connection); use of either required buying a code from the front desk for the amount of time desired. Tip: if you buy an hour of internet time, be sure to "log out" when you're done, then you can continue using the time at a later point. If you don't log out, the hour will simply run out even if you aren't using it. All in all, we were quite satisfied and would stay there again--but we'd bring a bar of soap.

Reviews.Title: “great Location, great Value and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: picchio42
Reviews.Content: We had a "comfort room". It was big and you could divide the sleeping area from the sitting area. Very small kitchen which was a bonus. Kettle supplied with vaious types of teas & coffe replenished every day. Good sized fridge , handy for keeping yogurt for breakfast and bottles of Spumante.!! We did not have the breakfast as was 96 euros for 4 nights. Too dear considerin all the places round about where it was much cheeper and really good. Only slight draw back was that shower was fixed to wall but just above bath. Needed to hold it. Don't know if every room the same. In reception computer for use of guests free. Reception printed off tickets no charge and very helpful. They also booked some places we wanted to reserve but we could not speak German. They spoke English and Italian very well. Area is great. Public transport Metro nearby. Bus 100 or 200 dont' remember which but one of the Tourist Route busses, stops just along the road. Late night busses as well. We went to the Irish Pub in the Europa Centre where there was live music every night - all types of music - cover bands. We made sure this was our last stop as the hotel was only 100 meters away. We found out you could walk inside the Centre to the last exit and from there it was 2 doors to the hotel. Not bad when it is below freezing. I've stayed in 4 other hotels in Berlin more or less this category and they have all been acceptable. But I just felt there was that bit more for your money here. We have just booked it again for this winter!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PudseyMeath
Reviews.Content: There is a steel spaghetti type sculpture opposite the entrance to the hotel which is in a small shopping arcade.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel good for the price”
Reviews.Author: roy1982
Reviews.Content: Since it was a fairly cheap 3 star hotel right in the center of where we needed to be for a conference it was very convenient. The entrance is kinda hard to find and the lack of minibar in the hotelroom was kinda disturbing the stay was more then enough and money well spend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, right downtown near the best shops and restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: Reisefanatic
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you get it for under $80-$90(US funds) It is nothing fancy, the rooms are a decent size and clean. We picked a room in the back overlooking the courtyard. Rm 211 (view not much to look at, however quiet) If you would rather spend your money on restaurants and entertainment this is the place. As has been mentioned by others the entrance is not much to look at, however they were making some inprovements while we were there. The staff is courteous and proffessional. You are a short walk from the famous KaDeWe( a must see just for the food floor) Also a short walking distance from a central train station.(Zoologisher Garten) Purcahse the Berlin Welcome card. This will get you unlimited train(Ubahn, Sbahn and buses and Trams) travel. Pick zones ABC if you want to include Potsdam. Prices vary depending on how long you are staying. This will also give you discounts on other thigs as well. No need to rent a car. There is a supermarket called Ullrich under the station, where you can pick up provisions. i.e chocolate at reduced prices. This will get you everywhere. See Potsdam (Dutch quarter and shopping area, quite quaint)(Sansouci) ,Charlottenburg. Of course Check Point Charlie and remnants of the wall. Brandenburger Gate. Walk Unter den Linden, and go to the old town part near the river Spree. If you like history go see the Citadel at Spandau.If you are out and about and like fresh fish, eat at Nordsee (fast food) very tasty and they are all over. Reasonably piced. Seelachs( this is a type of fish). If you like fine dining with a traditional Prussian fare. (not too expensive) then go to Marjellchen off the KurFurstendamm (a great palce to walk and see wonderfull shops) Another great value is a Croation(name escapes me, easy to find) restaurant at Bellvue station, two stops away. It is right under the train station. Great value with huge portions. Berlin is a safe city. Just be aware near the train stations. Lastly take the city Circle tour bus. It allows you to hop on and off at your own pace. You also get a discount from your Berlin Welcome card. Great way to see Berlin. Do this the first day. Then you can pick what you would like to go see again later. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “All that you need”
Reviews.Author: Gexxie
Reviews.Content: The vacation was about re-visiting the Berlin wall as I had lived in Berlin 20 years before. This hotel is very central with a lot of great shopping, food and drink all only a short walk away. Great for the underground and overland rail services, and buss's galore. The hotel does not have a swish lobby, but is secure and in the middle of a busy city I think that was important. Reception staff were fine and helpful, rooms very clean and spacious - no great views from the balcony - but what can you expect in a busy city. The breakfast was typical cold meats and cheese, not a great selection but plenty enough to give you fuel for a busy day sight-seeing. Overall a perfect hotel if you are going to be out and about, don't think I would stay there for business though. No lobby to meet in, and no bar/coffee shop or other areas to relax in.

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: ADRIAN888
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a short break to this hotel I have mixed feelings about the whole experience. The hotel has many good points. It a solid base to explore Berlin is its location can not be beaten. Next to KaDeWe, next to a taxi rank, 5 mins walk from the AirportExpress station of Zoological Garden and close to many good bars and eateries. The rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable and the staff are very helpful. However, do not stay here unless you get a deal as there are better options within the nearby area that would be far,far better if you have 100 euros a night to spend. We were lucky and got the room for 60 euros but to be fair I would have been unhappy to have paid any more.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: VeroArgentina
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, confortable rooms, we´ll certainly stay there again.Friendly personal. The only thing, is the hidden entrance, you have to "discover" it, thanks to the reading of the opinion of others travelers we knew that so we got there quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Twin Toddlers in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: WintersTale
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel, with very specific requirements in mind. travelling with 14 month old twins, are priority was for a hotel providing family friendly rooms, in a quiet, but central location. This hotel ticked all the boxes, and more. Our room was perfect, very clean, and designed well, allowing us to make use of a partition to allow us to relax,in fornt of the TV, when the children went to their cots. The cots and furnishing supplied were all great, and excellent double-glazing meant that whilst the hotel, is bang centre of a main street, there was no traffic noise, at all. The highlight for our daughter was the beautifully designed breakfast room. Bright and airy, this room presented a really nice way to kick off your day. We found the breakfast great for adults and babies alike, and never left hungry. The waitress staff, were all fantastic with our children, making them feel really special. One thing which really impressed me was the security in the hotel. Swipe cards had to be used to access the front/corridor and room doors, not that I felt particularly intimidated at any time, but it's worth mentioning if you are travelling on your own. My only criticism was with the hotel's housekeeping and reception staff. We asked for replacement coffee and spare nappies (which the hotel says they can provide on their web-site) and the coffee never arrived, and they had no nappies left. We asked about train times to the airport, and the details supplied were wrong, which meant we missed the train we’d like to have caught, and ended up with a lot of clock watching as set on the later train, airport bound…not the ideal way to end a holiday when you’ve toddlers in tow. All in all we were happy enough with our experience, that on our next visit to this great city, we'll be staying in the same hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Silverino
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent four days at the Berliner Hof in August 2008 and we were very happy. We were given a very large double room and a large bathroom. The modern bedroom had a very large size bed, wardrobe, medium size TV set with local channels, refrigerator, table and chairs. The bathroom had a bathtub and was very clean. Breakfast was included in the price paid and was very good: there was a selection of breads, croissants, cereals, fresh fruits salads, marmalade, choice of cheese, smoked salmon, fruit juice.. The surrounding area is excellent, couldn't be better. It's just few meters from the famous KaDeWe, and it's close to all shopping streets, the famous Zoo, public transportation..

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: AName
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in middle May 2008 as part of a business trip. My overall impression was good and I would happily stay here again. Having read the other reviews here, its difficult to know what else to say, so my main good and bad points are: I paid 110 euro per night for a large room, with separate toilet and bathroom; small kitchen area (sink, fridge, kettle, plates and utensils); a separate (small) living room (sofa, tv, working table); a bedroom sandwiched between corridor from bathroom/door to the living room area. Positive things: - Location excellent for transportation, shops, restaurants, bars, etc - Room was big enough - Door between living room (where windows are) and bedroom, meant quiet sleep - Internet (paid, not free), both Wi-Fi and wired - Nice breakfast, better than the standard German fair - Staff nice and helpful - Lots of TV stations including CNN and BBC World - Price / value for money Negative things: - No bar/lobby/meeting area - No restaurant for evening meals. But Pizza Hut at entrance if you desperate - Street entrance is awful, but don’t let that put you off - Pillows – usual German horrible flat things

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and quiet in the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: travelerbc
Reviews.Content: Booked a single room for 4 days during FruitLogistika trade show. Very good location on Ku-Dam district – shopping, restaurants, city tours all nearby. The personnel was very friendly and helpful with directions. Room was spacious, clean with new furniture. Breakfast buffet was very good too, especially if you compare it to the same price hotels in Paris or London – there you will get only toasts, eggs and coffee for the same money. Metro station was within 5 minutes walk, and a bus from the trade show in the evening stopped near hotel. I visited couple of other hotels in the city. The amenities in 4 star hotels were similar to Berliner- Hof, but the location was much further from the center, and the price was higher. I would definitely recommend Berliner Hof as a good value, safe and quiet place in Berlin. Elena Canada

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: max-and-eager
Reviews.Content: This is a midprice hotel in a convenient central Berlin location. You wont get a lovely view to admire from your balcony, but don't be put off by the unglamorous surroundings: once you get inside, the hotel is just fine, with clean rooms and comfy beds; the usual continental style breakfast and pleasant helpful staff. This place does what you want without breaking the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the can......”
Reviews.Author: smudge66
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Berliner Hof, Tauzienstrasser, Berlin in Early Dec 2005. This hotel forms part of the Europa Center in the former West of Berlin very near to Zoo U Bahn and S Bahn Stations. Firstly must comment on the hotel entrance-DO NOT LET THIS PUT YOU OFF. It is literally steps away from one of Berlin's main streets Tauzienstrasse and couldn't be more centrally placed for shops, nightlife, restauarants and transport links etc. Saying this however the access point is via a narrow shopping arcade adjacent to Pizza Hut which doesn't look very thrilling. The entrance looks very sparse and bland but the lift takes you straight to the main reception on an upper floor and once there the hotel is an absolute pleasure.... Very sleek and modern, clean lines, quality furnishing, impeccably clean and staff are all very pleasant and welcoming. Breakfast is served on the top floor in a superb breakfast room which was a joy to dine in. So clean and modern, staff replenish buffet speedily. Excellent choice and variety, modern furniture, very reminiscent of IKEA or Radisson SAS at altogether realistic prices for a Capital City Centre hotel. We've stayed in other Berlin hotels over seven years which were equally as conformtable but the room rates per night were far more- hence the Berliner Hof was a gem at a fair price. Have recommended to others and would certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Berliner Hof”
Reviews.Author: jcl
Reviews.Content: The guidebook quoted on TripAdvisor calls the entrance to the hotel "discreet"; I would call it dingy, strewn with debris. But the room was fairly nice and clean yet smallish. The location is one of its attractions: right in the middle of good shopping (Ka De We, etc.) and near the Gedaechtniskirche. Bahnhof Zoo is withing walking distance.

HotelInfo.Name: Berliner Hof
HotelInfo.Address: Tauentzienstrasse 8, 10789 Berlin, Germany
